intro: Psychotria ibitipocae, commonly known as the Ibitipoca Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded understory environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited distribution.
